newsitem.title: UK: Japanese stocks in London flat ahead of expiry.
newsitem.headline: Japanese stocks in London flat ahead of expiry.

text.p: Japanese stocks in London were steady to slightly lower in quiet dealings on Wednesday, with investors sidelined by Friday's Nikkei future and options expiry and the lacklustre performance on the Tokyo bourse.
"The expiry is keeping people away and with Wall Street set to open lower, we're not expecting much business this afternoon. We should trend a couple of ticks lower," one dealer said.
The Nikkei 50 index in London was barely changed at 1342 GMT, up 0.80 point at 1,394.79, as the market took its cue from a meagre 0.06 percent rise on the Tokyo Nikkei.

Dealers noted some profit-taking in hi-tech stocks, hit by a profit warning from U.S. technology stock Motorola Inc. earlier in the day, but said the market was on a sound footing, helped by the dollar around 110 yen.

Dealers expected little movement this week ahead of the expiry and said uncertainty about the timing of Japan's next elections, which would affect the launch of the expected supplementary budget, would tend to deter investors.
